description.narrative: 2.1 Provide leadership to the development of a regional WWSO action plan.,2.2 Encourage PEAC Bishops and lay leaders to become active members in WWSO regional coalition.,2.3 Promote PEAC (Anglican church-based) SGBV prevention and response activities among WWSO coalition members.,1.1 PEAC Project Management Accompaniment Activities,1.2 PEAC Project Evaluation Accompaniment Activities,1.3 Technical Resource Activities

The Province of the Anglican Church in Congo (PEAC) Provincial Departments of Development and Social Transformation and Service Medical along with the PEAC Diocese of Aru and Episcopal Relief & Development's support have developed a one-year pilot project targeting sexual and gender based violence (SGBV). The overarching goal of this project is to increase church and community participation in SGBV prevention and response, and to establish a model SGBV prevention and response program approach that can be replicated in other PEAC dioceses in future years. Through the USAID-funded project USHINDI (Swahili for victory), IMA World Health has developed experience in helping women to overcome SGBV using a holistic approach that supports survivors and prevents future violence. Through this project accompaniment IMA World Health will provide the consultancy time of their SGBV technical expert, Louise BASHIGE NZIGIRE, to provide guidance to PEAC, specifically the SGBV Project Team in Aru, in their work of SGBV prevention and response advocacy, project planning, project implementation, and project results change evaluation.
